Authors:
Gustavo Henrique Jer√¥nimo, Ana Lucia Jesus, Timothy Y.
James, Carmen Lidia Amorim Pires-Zottarelli, D Rabern Simmons
Title:
Novel taxa in Cladochytriales (Chytridiomycota): Karlingiella
(gen. nov.) and Nowakowskiella crenulata (sp. nov.)
Keywords:
chytrid, Karlingiella, Nowakowskiella crenulata,
phylogeny, two new taxa
Abstract:
Six Nowakowskiella species from Brazil were identified and
purified on nutrient agar and placed into a phylogenetic framework for
the genus. New sequence data are presented for four species: N.
elongata, N. multispora and N. ramosa and the new species N. crenulata.
Our combined maximum likelihood and bayesian analyses from SSU, 5.8S
(ITS) and LSU regions of rDNA showed that Nowakowskiella is not a
monophyletic clade due the position of Nowakowskiella elongata, which is
more related to Cladochytrium. We reclassify N. elongata as the type of
the new genus Karlingiella.
